ygData.subject: Re: Level 61
ygData.msgSnippet: I could see them allowing some crossover at very high levels.  If you had to research every spell and had to spend points specializing in another class as
ygData.messageBody:
I could see them allowing some crossover at very high levels. If you had to
research every spell and had to spend points specializing in another class
as opposed to a type.

-- Elidain, Wizard 16th Veeshan

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Goodman [mailto:goodman@...]
> Sent: Saturday, May 22, 1999 5:21 PM
> To: EQ_spell_research@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [EQ_spell_research] Level 61
>
>
> From: Goodman <goodman@...>
>
>
> An interesting side note, i belive Verant made it this way
> to not let
> you hev it HOWEVER, the expansion will supposedly raise the level cap to
> 75... so perhaps these will be usable then? I wonder what they will
> do...
>
> - Sythe, CazicThule
>
> Steven Zaharakis wrote:
> >
> > From: Steven Zaharakis <sz200@...>
> >
> >
> > I think thats just Verants way of not letting you have
> the spell at all,
> > making it set to a level that is unreachable. I don't think
> spellcasters
> > will ever get to learn spells from every other school. What
> would be the
> > point of classes then?
> >
> > Zolthar
> >
> > At 03:24 AM 5/22/99 -0500, you wrote:
> > >From: "Nick Burnett" <nburnett@...>
> > >
> > >I attempted to scribe the spell 'Enchant Silver' as a Wizard,
> and I got the
> > >message "You must be level 61 to scribe this spell."
> > >
> > >I am conjecturing that with the expansion and levels above 50,
> spellcasters
> > >will be able to learn spells from other schools. Just an interesting
> > >theory, considering the game seems to think I could learn an
> Enchanter spell
> > >as a Wizard provided I am level 61 :)
> > >
> > >

> > >>> > I'm going to assume this is just a rumor. I
> > >>> > wouldn't see the point of building another mage type

> > >>> > Wizard's would be everywhere! I could be wrong.....

> > >>> > location-specific gate spells. Let me know what you

> > >>> >
> > >>> >
> > >>> >

> > >>> > learn spells that would otherwise be available only

> > >>> > example, I am hoping this is the case with my
> > >>> > Wizard, I want to learn SoW
> > >>> > desperately (don't we all?).
> > >>> >
> > >>> > SOE needs to do a better job of explaining
> > >>> > research. ;)
